Ravelyn works hard to support her family. Ravelyn is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Ravelyn requested a 7,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell in her general store.

Ravelyn has been in this business for one year now. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell in her general store

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food-vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 5,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food-vending business.

Rebecca has been in this business for four years. Rebecca earns more income from a general store.

Rebecca has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food-production business

loans.name: May

May runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell in her general store.

May has been in this business for 3 years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, seasonings, shampoo, detergent soap, soft drinks, etc. 

In the future, May would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell in her general store

loans.name: Meazel

Meazel has been in this business for 4 years and sells a variety of items such as those listed above.

Meazel would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

Roselyn has borrowed and paid one loan from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for one year and also earns an income from raising pigs.

Roselyn aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

Sarah would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.name: Rosadelma

Rosadelma has borrowed and paid two loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for eight years and she earns additional income from food-vending.

Rosadelma aspires to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.name: Rosalinda

She works tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure her family's future.

Venancia requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

In the future, Venancia would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

Arfen Jescil requested a PHP 1,800 loan through NWTF to buy a solar lamp.

She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to have backup light in case of an emergency.

Arfen Jescil is aware that by using the solar lamp, she is not only saving money, she is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

Donna is 35-years-old, married with two children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Donna has a food vending business in the Philippines. Donna requested a PHP 5,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food business.

Donna has been in this business for eight years. In the future, Donna would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is 47 years old and is married with five children, two of whom are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Marilou has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Marilou requested a 6,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to buy more fish to sell.

Marilou has been in this business for 24 years. In the future, Marilou would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Basilisa

texts.en:

Basilisa requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional tools for her business.

Basilisa has been in this business for 15 years now.

In the future, Basilisa would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional tools for her business

loans.name: Rosita

Rosita is 55 years old, married with eight children. Three of her children are in school, she is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Rosita has a charcoal retailing business in the Philippines. Rosita requested a PHP 6000 loan amount through NWTF in order to purchase additional stocks of charcoal to sell.

Rosita has been in this business for ten years. In the future, Rosita would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Edwina

texts.en:
Edwina is 57 years old and married with four children.

She earns a living by having a pig fattening business in the Philippines. Edwina is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Edwina has been in the pig fattening business for 6 years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Shella

texts.en:
Shella is 46 years old, married with five children, two of whom are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.  

Shella has a food vending business in the Philippines. Shella requested a PHP 5000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food business.

Shella has been in this business for two years. In the future, Shella would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Hazel

texts.en:
Hazel is 54 years old, married with four children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.  

Hazel has a frozen food business in the Philippines. Hazel requested a PHP 4000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy additional stocks of frozen food for resale.

Hazel has been in this business for five years. In the future, Hazel would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of frozen foods for resale.

loans.name: Arsenia

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Arsenia works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell recyclable materials business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from a general store and firewood vending. Arsenia is borrowing PHP 8000 through NWTF to buy more recyclable materials to sell for her buy and sell recyclable materials business.

Arsenia has sustained her business activities through her past 8 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more recyclable materials to sell

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia is 60 years old and widowed with 2 children.  With 2 children in school, Lilia works very hard to provide for them.

Lilia runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.

Lilia has been in this business for nine years and sells a variety of items such as bread, biscuits, noodles and other groceries. 

In the future Lilia would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma is fifty-five years old and married with two children. She earns a living by raising livestock in the Philippines. She has been raising livestock for 6 years and earns some additional income from the general store.

Gemma is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy feed, vitamins and vaccines for her livestock.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream, which is to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins and vaccines for her livestock

loans.name: Charlyn

texts.en:
Charlyn is thirty-three years old and married with two children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a loan of PHP 8,000 through NWTF to purchase items to sell like canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar and noodles.

Before this loan, Charlyn paid back two loans from NWTF. She has been running the general store for four years and also earns an income from farming rice and sugar cane.

Charlyn aspires to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase items to sell like canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar and noodles

loans.name: Welyn

Welyn is 40 years old and married with four children, two of whom are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Welyn has a food vending business in the Philippines. Welyn requested a PHP 5000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food business.

Welyn has been in this business for twenty years. In the future, Welyn would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

She has a buy and sell ready to wear business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from raising livestock. Chelamie is borrowing PHP 9500 through NWTF to buy more stocks of ready to wear clothes for her buy and sell ready to wear business.

Chelamie has sustained her business activities through her past 2 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of ready to wear

loans.name: Evelyn

Evelyn is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She has requested a loan of PHP 11,000 through NWTF to buy feed, vitamins and other supplies for her business.

Evelyn has been raising pigs for 13 years and has borrowed 3 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business. In the future, Evelyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins and other supplies for her business

loans.name: Epefamia

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a loan of PHP 8,000 through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

Before this loan, Epefamia paid back two loans from NWTF. She has been running the general store for 3 years and also earns an income from raising pigs. She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items like shampoo and groceries to sell

loans.name: Elmer

Elmer has been in this business for twenty years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business and increase her family's home.

Liza has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.name: Jane

Jane has been in this business for 3 years and sells a variety of items such as shampoo, laundry soap, coffee, sugar, milk, etc. 

Jane would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.name: Ruth

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, soap, milk, canned goods, chips, eggs, etc. in her general store business.

She has been in this business for three years. Ruth earns additional income from raising pigs.

Ruth has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, soap, milk, canned goods, chips and eggs.

Jessica has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

Davelinda has been in this business for seven years. In the future, Davelinda would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.
